mantras.title: Maths: The Power of Zero
mantras.text: Any number multiplied by 0 is always 0. Any number (except 0) raised to the power of 0 is always 1!

mantras.title: Science: Space Silence
mantras.text: Sound needs air to travel. Since there is no air in space, it is completely silent, no matter how loud an explosion is.

mantras.title: Maths: Prime Number Fact
mantras.text: The number 2 is very specialâ€”it is the only even prime number in the entire universe. Every other prime number is odd.

mantras.title: Science: The Blue Sky
mantras.text: The sky is blue because Earth's atmosphere scatters blue light from the sun more than other colors.

mantras.title: Maths: Palindrome Numbers
mantras.text: A palindrome is a number that reads the same backward and forward, like 121 or 1331.

mantras.title: Science: Water's Three States
mantras.text: Water is the only substance on Earth that naturally exists as a solid (ice), liquid (water), and gas (steam).

mantras.title: Maths: Multiplying by 10
mantras.text: The easiest trick in math: to multiply a whole number by 10, just stick a 0 at the end of it!

mantras.title: Science: Octopus Hearts
mantras.text: An octopus has three hearts! Two pump blood to the gills, and one pumps it to the rest of the body.

mantras.title: Maths: Shape Sides
mantras.text: A hexagon has 6 sides, an octagon has 8, and a decagon has 10. Think of an 'Octo'-pus to remember 8!

mantras.title: Science: Hot Water Freeze
mantras.text: Surprisingly, hot water can sometimes freeze faster than cold water. This is called the Mpemba effect.

mantras.title: Maths: Roman Numerals
mantras.text: The Romans didn't have a symbol for zero. They used letters like I (1), V (5), X (10), L (50), and C (100).

mantras.title: Science: Gravity on Moon
mantras.text: Gravity on the Moon is only about 1/6th as strong as on Earth. You could jump 6 times higher there!

mantras.title: Maths: Magic of 9
mantras.text: Multiply 9 by any number from 1 to 10, and the digits of the answer will always add up to 9. (Example: 9x5=45, 4+5=9).

mantras.title: Science: Plant Breathing
mantras.text: Plants 'breathe' in Carbon Dioxide and 'breathe' out Oxygen, which is exactly the opposite of what humans do.

mantras.title: Maths: The Number 'Pi'
mantras.text: Pi (3.14...) is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter. It is an infinite number that never ends!

mantras.title: Science: Lightning Heat
mantras.text: A bolt of lightning is 5 times hotter than the surface of the sun!

mantras.title: Maths: Even and Odd
mantras.text: Even + Even = Even. Odd + Odd = Even. But Even + Odd is always Odd!

mantras.title: Science: Banana DNA
mantras.text: Humans share about 50% of their DNA with bananas. We are more related to fruit than we think!

mantras.title: Maths: Centi, Milli, Kilo
mantras.text: Centi means 100, Milli means 1,000, and Kilo also means 1,000. 1 Kilogram is 1,000 grams.

mantras.title: Science: Heavy Clouds
mantras.text: Even though they float, an average white fluffy cloud weighs about 1 million pounds (the weight of 100 elephants)!

mantras.title: Maths: Triangle Angles
mantras.text: If you add up the three inside angles of any triangle, they will always equal exactly 180 degrees.

mantras.title: Science: No Stomach?
mantras.text: Platypuses do not have stomachs. Their food goes straight from the esophagus to their intestines.

mantras.title: Maths: Dividing by 2
mantras.text: Any number that ends in 0, 2, 4, 6, or 8 is even and can always be divided by 2 without a remainder.

mantras.title: Science: Rusting Iron
mantras.text: Iron rusts when it reacts with both water and oxygen. Without one of those, it won't rust!

mantras.title: Maths: Hours in a Year
mantras.text: There are 8,760 hours in a normal year and 8,784 hours in a leap year.

mantras.title: Science: Solar System King
mantras.text: Jupiter is so big that all the other planets in the solar system could fit inside it twice!

mantras.title: Maths: Square Numbers
mantras.text: A square number is what you get when you multiply a number by itself. 3x3=9, so 9 is a square number.

mantras.title: Science: Human Teeth
mantras.text: Human teeth are just as strong as shark teeth! However, we can't regrow them as fast as sharks can.

mantras.title: Maths: Clock Math
mantras.text: A circle has 360 degrees. Since a clock is a circle, each minute represents a 6-degree turn for the minute hand.

mantras.title: Science: Speed of Earth
mantras.text: Earth is spinning at about 1,000 miles per hour and orbiting the sun at 67,000 miles per hour, but we can't feel it!
